title: san serif flourish
content:
there are many gorgeous serif style typefaces with beautiful flourishes. [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/ambassador-script/flourishes/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009105947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/ambassador-script/flourishes/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/ambassador-script/flourishes/")

does anyone know of a typeface with flourishes that appear more sans serif, if that makes any sense?

 [‹ Researching 'Computer' Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009105947/http:/typophile.com/node/35550 "Go to previous forum topic") [looking for fonts with mixed upper and lower case letters. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009105947/http:/typophile.com/node/39850 "Go to next forum topic")
author: photosynthesize

comments.content:
Hi Emma,  
there’s a picture of Univers Flair and Franklin Gothic Flair [in this old thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009105947/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2833). Someone couldn’t resist to do Helvetica Flair, too, scroll down [this interview with Phil Martin at Typopraphica](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009105947/http:/typographica.org/000852.php).  
However, not sure if that’s what you meant.  
F

[Aspect](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009105947/http:/www.typography.net/type/aspect.htm)  
 [Auto](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009105947/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=auto&id2=threeitalics) (the italics, esp #3)

...er, um, i think i misunderstood the assignment.
i do apologise - flourish may not be the correct terminology. i’m talking more about symbols i think (take a look at the link i posted?).
